attributes.action: Ban on Conversion Therapy to Protect Trans Rights
attributes.additional_details: A complete ban on conversion therapy is vital to protect the mental health and human rights of transgender people. Conversion therapy is a practice aimed at changing someone’s sexual orientation or gender identity. This harmful practice lacks scientific basis, promotes stigma, and leads to significant psychological distress. A comprehensive ban supports inclusivity and student well-being in university environments, reinforcing the UK’s commitment to equality and human dignity for all.
attributes.background: Eradicate the 'coerced' requirement and fully ban all trans conversion therapy, closing legal loopholes to safeguard transgender rights and mental health more effectively.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for a similar action:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/651110
